channel.title: Need help please?
channel.description: Uhhh....When i was at my house(my ip) my server worked then i went to his house(a different ip) it doesnt let me log on it...and i changed ip on no-ip and in the client used to log on and it still doesnt work??

item.title: Need help please?

item.description:
@tb1 wrote:

wrath stop posting that ugly guide on every page so we can actually help them. Your making this page way too long, just send him a link to the guide dont post it here.

ok? I dont mean to be rude, but it looks bad and it takes up 50% of the page…

Read full topic

item.title: Need help please?
item.dc:creator: @wrath0fgufix wrath0fgufix
item.description:
@wrath0fgufix wrote:

You need to have portforwarded correct and made sure your firewall works-- so other people can connect into your internet–

A guide of my own on port forwarding:

Hello, i am showing how to portforward on your router.

First you’ll need to find your gateway ip address. Open your start menu and push the tab “run”

Then a small box will pop up–type in “Cmd” like the following

Then a new box will pop up that looks like this:

From here you will type in “ipconfig”

Then it will pop up a different things, you’ll want to find a “default gateway”
Next you will open your internet, and as your url you will type the “default gateway in the url.” Something sorta like this will be shown:

3590qya.jpg383×800

Then you will find something like virtual servers, it will ask you for a password leave it blank or use “admin”
It will then bring you to a different page that will look somewhat like this (matters what router you have)

It should be on the blank part where it shows mine".5" will be your ip adress the last numbers mine is actually "2"so…

It should look like that or maybe w/o UDP
Then you can either use no-ip.org or www.whatsmyip.org

I will add a tut on how to get no-ip if people ask-- Thanks.

that was my guide until it got locked…:’(-- that should make it work if your confused about your router ask…

Read full topic
